newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan agricultural bank runs up $1.25 bln debt.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan agricultural bank runs up $1.25 bln debt.

text.p: The state-owned Agricultural Development Bank of Pakistan had run up 50.51 billion rupees ($1.25 billion) in debts at the end of fiscal 1995/96 (July-June), Petroleum and Natural Resources Minister Javed Jabbar said on Thursday.
He told the Senate (upper house) that the bank had earnings of only 198 million rupees ($4.9 million) in 1995/96.
Its liabilities included 40 billion rupees of domestic debt and 10.53 billion rupees of foreign debt, he said.
